about.title: About THEJORD
about.subtitle: The Italian alternative to IT-Tools. Free, fast, and privacy-focused developer tools.

mission.title: Our Mission
mission.intro: THEJORD.IT was born with the goal of offering an Italian platform for developer tools, completely free and privacy-respecting.
mission.believe: We believe that development tools should be:

privacy.title: Privacy-First
privacy.description: All tools work 100% client-side. Your data never leaves your browser.

fast.title: Lightning Fast
fast.description: No server round-trips means instant results, even with large files.

intuitive.title: Intuitive
intuitive.description: Clean and modern interfaces for an optimal user experience.

openSource.title: Open Source
openSource.description: The source code is public and contributions are welcome!

techStack.title: Tech Stack
techStack.description: THEJORD is built with modern technologies to ensure performance and reliability:

openSource.title: Open Source
openSource.description: THEJORD is completely open source. You can contribute, report bugs, or use the code for your projects.

privacy.title: Privacy & Security
privacy.description: Your privacy is our priority. Here's how we protect your data:

clientSide.title: 100% Client-Side Processing
clientSide.description: All tools process data directly in your browser. No data is ever sent to our servers.

noAccount.title: No Account Required
noAccount.description: No registration, no tracking, no login required.

securityHeaders.title: Security Headers
securityHeaders.description: HTTPS only, CSP, HSTS and other security best practices implemented.

auditable.title: Auditable Code
auditable.description: Open source code that can be verified by anyone.

contact.title: Questions or Feedback?
contact.description: We'd love to hear from you! Get in touch or open an issue on GitHub.

contact.title: Contact Us
contact.description: Have questions, feedback, or want to collaborate? We're here to help!

github.title: GitHub Issues
github.description: Report bugs or request new features

security.title: Security Issues
security.warning: If you've discovered a security vulnerability, DO NOT open a public issue.

form.title: Send a Message
form.name: Name
form.subject: Subject
form.note: Clicking "Send Message" will open your default email client

contribute.question: How can I contribute to the project?
contribute.answer: Visit our GitHub repository, fork it, make your changes, and submit a pull request. We welcome all contributions!

security.question: How do I report a security vulnerability?
security.answer: Please DO NOT open a public issue. Instead, email us at security@thejord.it with details about the vulnerability.

selfhost.question: Can I self-host THEJORD?
selfhost.answer: Yes! The project is open source and can be self-hosted. Check our GitHub repository for deployment instructions.

free.question: Is THEJORD really free?
free.answer: Yes, 100% free forever. No subscriptions, no hidden costs, no limits.

request.question: Can I request a new tool?
request.answer: Absolutely! Open an issue on GitHub with the "feature request" label and describe the tool you'd like to see.

intro.title: Introduction
intro.text: At THEJORD, we take your privacy seriously. This Privacy Policy explains how we collect, use, and protect your personal information when you visit our website. We are committed to GDPR compliance and transparency in all our data practices.

approach.title: Our Privacy-First Approach
approach.text: THEJORD is built with privacy as a core principle:

points.clientSide: All developer tools process data 100% client-side in your browser
points.noServer: Tool data never leaves your device or reaches our servers
points.noAccount: No user accounts or personal data storage required
points.minimalAnalytics: Minimal analytics with IP anonymization enabled

analytics.title: Analytics Data (Google Analytics 4)
analytics.text: We use Google Analytics 4 to understand how visitors use our site. The following information is collected with IP anonymization enabled:

points.pages: Pages you visit and time spent on each page

tools.title: Tool Usage Data
tools.text: Our developer tools (JSON formatter, Base64 encoder, regex tester, etc.) process all data entirely in your browser. We do not collect, store, or transmit any data you input into these tools.

cookies.title: Cookies We Use
cookies.text: We use minimal cookies for essential functionality:

usage.title: How We Use Your Information
usage.text: The limited data we collect is used exclusively for:

points.popularity: Understanding which pages and tools are most popular
points.ux: Improving user experience based on usage patterns
points.traffic: Analyzing traffic sources to guide content creation

usage.noSale: We never sell, rent, or share your data with third parties for marketing purposes.

gdpr.title: Your Rights Under GDPR
gdpr.text: If you are in the European Union, you have the following rights:

rights.access: Request a copy of data we hold about you
rights.erasure: Request deletion of your data (right to be forgotten)
rights.restrict: Request limitation on how we use your data
rights.portability: Request data transfer in a machine-readable format
rights.object: Object to data processing for specific purposes
rights.withdraw: Withdraw consent for analytics at any time

optout.title: How to Opt Out of Analytics
optout.text: You can opt out of Google Analytics tracking in several ways:

points.banner: Use the cookie consent banner to disable analytics cookies
points.addon: Install the Google Analytics Opt-out Browser Add-on
points.dnt: Enable "Do Not Track" in your browser settings
points.extensions: Use browser extensions that block analytics scripts

thirdParty.title: Third-Party Services
thirdParty.text: We use the following third-party services:

ga.title: Google Analytics 4
ga.text: For website analytics with IP anonymization enabled. View Google's privacy policy at

children.title: Children's Privacy
children.text: Our services are not directed at children under 16. We do not knowingly collect personal information from children. If you believe a child has provided us with personal information, please contact us to have it removed.

international.title: International Data Transfers
international.text: Analytics data may be processed by Google in countries outside the EU/EEA. Google is certified under the EU-US Data Privacy Framework and provides appropriate safeguards for data protection.

changes.title: Changes to This Policy
changes.text: We may update this Privacy Policy from time to time. Changes will be posted on this page with an updated "Last updated" date. Significant changes will be prominently announced on our website.

contactSection.title: Contact Us
contactSection.text: If you have questions about this Privacy Policy or wish to exercise your rights:
contactSection.visitChangelog: Refer to our Changelog for privacy-related updates

legal.title: Legal Basis for Processing
legal.text: Under GDPR, our legal basis for processing your data is:
legal.legitimate: For analytics to improve our service
legal.consent: For optional analytics cookies (via cookie consent banner)
legal.withdraw: You can withdraw consent at any time through the cookie consent banner or by contacting us.

changelog.title: Changelog
changelog.description: All changes and updates to THEJORD

cookies.title: Cookies
cookies.message: We use cookies to improve your experience. You can accept or reject them.

common.privacyNotice: All processing happens in your browser. Your data never leaves your device.

regexTester.title: RegExp Tester
regexTester.description: Test regular expressions with real-time matching and highlighting.
regexTester.testStringPlaceholder: Enter text to test against your regex...

jsonFormatter.description: Format, validate, and beautify JSON instantly. All processing happens in your browser.
jsonFormatter.enterValidJson: Enter valid JSON to see tree view

base64Tool.description: Encode or decode Base64 strings. All processing happens in your browser.
base64Tool.aboutBase64Text: Base64 is a binary-to-text encoding scheme that represents binary data in an ASCII string format. It's commonly used to encode data that needs to be stored or transferred over media designed to handle text.
base64Tool.useCase1: Encoding images for data URIs in HTML/CSS
base64Tool.useCase2: Storing complex data in cookies or URLs
base64Tool.useCase5: Embedding binary data in JSON or XML
base64Tool.clickDownloadToSave: Click "Download" button to save the file.

hashGenerator.description: Generate cryptographic hashes using various algorithms.
hashGenerator.hmacDescription: HMAC (Hash-based Message Authentication Code) uses a secret key to create a keyed hash.
hashGenerator.enterKeyAbove: Please enter a secret key above
hashGenerator.hashingDescription: Cryptographic hash functions generate a fixed-size string from any input data. They are one-way functions (cannot be reversed).
hashGenerator.secNote1: MD5 is broken, avoid for security

urlTool.description: Encode or decode URLs and URI components.
urlTool.enterEncodedUrl: Enter encoded URL or component to decode...
urlTool.encodeUriDesc: Encodes a complete URL. Preserves URL structure characters:
urlTool.encodeComponentDesc: Encodes URI components. Encodes ALL special characters including:
urlTool.useForParams: Use for query parameters and path segments

markdownConverter.description: Convert Markdown syntax to clean HTML code

colorConverter.description: Pick colors and convert between HEX, RGB, HSL, and CMYK formats
colorConverter.hexUsed: Used in: CSS, HTML, design tools
colorConverter.rgbUsed: Used in: Screen displays, web development

loremIpsum.description: Generate placeholder text for your designs and mockups
loremIpsum.startWithLorem: Start with "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet"
loremIpsum.clickToGenerate: Click 'Generate Lorem Ipsum' to create placeholder text...
loremIpsum.loremDescription: Lorem Ipsum is placeholder text commonly used in the graphic, print, and publishing industries for previewing layouts and visual mockups. It helps designers and developers focus on design elements without being distracted by meaningful content. The text is derived from sections 1.10.32 and 1.10.33 of "de Finibus Bonorum et Malorum" by Cicero, written in 45 BC.

diffChecker.description: Compare two texts and highlight the differences line by line

cronBuilder.description: Build and validate cron schedules with a visual interface
cronBuilder.enterCronExpression: Enter a cron expression with 5 fields: minute hour day month weekday
cronBuilder.clickPatternToApply: Click on a pattern to apply it to the builder:

jsonSchema.description: Generate JSON Schema from your JSON data automatically
jsonSchema.addFormatHints: Add format hints (email, uri, date, etc.)
jsonSchema.formatDetectionDesc: When "Add format hints" is enabled, the converter automatically detects and adds format specifications:
jsonSchema.typeMappingTitle: JSON to JSON Schema Type Mapping

xmlWsdlViewer.subtitle: Format, validate, and parse XML and WSDL files

convert.title: Convert XML ‚Üî JSON
convert.xmlPlaceholder: Paste XML to convert to JSON...
convert.jsonPlaceholder: Paste JSON to convert to XML...

pdfTools.subtitle: Merge, split, edit, convert and compress PDF files

merge.title: Merge PDFs
merge.description: Combine multiple PDF files into a single document

split.title: Split PDF
split.description: Extract specific pages or split into separate files

edit.title: Edit Pages
edit.description: Rotate, reorder or delete pages from PDF

editor.title: PDF Editor
editor.noFormFields: No form fields detected in this PDF

compress.title: Compress PDF
compress.preserveTextDesc: Less compression but text remains copyable. Disable for maximum compression.

common.uploadFirst: Upload a PDF file to get started
